Key Match Events: Bayo headed home from Ibrahim Diakite’s cross with just 22 seconds remaining in the last of eight minutes of stoppage time.
Nsue failed to make the most of a fortunate ricochet just two minutes after the interval as he volleyed wastefully over the bar from 10 yards
Mory Konate headed home from a free-kick in the 53rd minute, but the flag was instantly, and correctly, raised for offside
Federico Bikoro was shown a red card for a high-footed challenge which delivered a painful blow to Bayo’s ribs
Nsue hit the base of a post with his spot-kick
Jesus Owono comfortably tipped over substitute Serhou Guirassy’s 82nd-minute header
Miscellaneous Highlights: Guinea’s Mohamed Bayo reacts after scoring the winning goal during the Africa Cup of Nations match against Equatorial Guinea
Guinea’s Emilio Nsue reacts after missing a penalty kick against Guinea in the last 16 of the Africa Cup of Nations
The majority of the stoppage time had come from a lengthy VAR check which eventually saw Equatorial Guinea awarded a penalty for a foul by Sekou Sylla on Iban Salvador
